name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– Using the correct and complete set of drawings
– All drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Crushed rock mixes proposed for use on specified works shall be registered in accordance with VicRoads Code of Practice for Registration of Crushed Rock Mixes RC500.02 as listed in Section 175
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Mix Design VicRoads Approval
1.3 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: OHSCP, PHSCP, PCMP, EMP, ECP, CEMP, ERA, QMP, CHMP, SWMS
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: OHSCP, PHSCP, PCMP, EMP, ECP, CEMP, ERA, QMP, CHMP, SWMS
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Check prior to placing material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material should be spread to minimize number of joints. Transverse joints shall be offset from one layer to next by not less than 2 metres
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
FREQUENCY: Check prior to placing material

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material should be spread to minimize number of joints. Longitudinal joints offset from one layer to next by not less than 150mm. Longitudinal joints to be located within 300mm from planned traffic lane lines or within 300 mm of the centre of a traffic lane.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
FREQUENCY: Check prior to placing material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: A single lot shall be considered a single layer of 4000m2 or one days production in a single layer, whichever is lesser.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The maximum thickness of any pavement base layer shall not exceed 150 mm and the maximum thickness of any subbase layer shall not exceed 200 mm. The minimum thickness of any pavement layer shall be 4 times the nominal size of the material.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: No visible deformation or springing in presence of Superintendent's Rep.( Cl 173) Plant to comply with requirements of Cl 173.03.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
3.1 Determine Testing Scale & Initial Testing Frequency

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall initially test every lot for acceptance of compaction in accordance with the requirements of the Specification.  Testing of every lot shall continue until three consecutive lots of like material and/or work have achieved the standards specified.

• Scale B - The first lot of each pavement course shall be tested for post-compaction grading and PI. If the first lot each pavement course satisfies the specified post compaction requirements in Clause 304.10(a) and (b), as applicable, no further post-compaction testing will be required for that pavement course.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Table 204.161, Cl.304.08 (a), Cl.304.11 (b), Cl.304.11 (c)(i), Table 304.111
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document Review/ Site Inspection
FREQUENCY: Every Lot, Every second lot (reduced frequency)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Minimum Characteristic Density Ratio (CDR) of not less than 98%, using Modified compaction effort.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Cl304.08, Table 3040.061, Cl 304.11 (b), Table 304.111
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off; Test reports
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Post compaction material grading results must comply with the following:
• Class 3 - As per Table 304.101 - VR Spec. 304.10
• Class 2 - As per Table 304.101 - VR Spec. 304.10
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off; Test reports
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Post compaction PI results must comply with the following:
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off; Test reports
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Layer to be finished to a smooth and uniform surface and after compaction shall conform within the following limits:
• Shape: no point deviation > 8mm from 3m straight edge in any direction
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Cl 304.06(b, d, i), Drawings, Table 304.062
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off; Survey Report
